intro: Hieracium puschlachtae, commonly known as the Puschlachta hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in rocky and well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk and surrounding ray florets. Hieracium puschlachtae is often found in mountainous areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
